title_full: CMOBSUS01-BP01 Choose a Region based on both business requirements and sustainability goals
title: Choose a Region based on both business requirements and sustainability goals
description: Choose a Region to optimize KPIs including performance, cost, and carbon footprint. Edge devices on the move should connect to the closest Region to meet cost, network latency, and sustainability requirements. Configure critical workloads as active/active per business and regulatory requirements. Avoid short-lived connections from edge to reduce connection overhead.
outcome: Optimized region selection balancing performance, cost, and environmental impact

title_full: CMOBSUS02-BP01 Scale workload infrastructure dynamically
title: Scale workload infrastructure dynamically
description: Use elasticity of the cloud and scale cloud and connected devices dynamically to match supply to demand and avoid over-provisioned capacity. Monitor edge capacity and use onboard capability to the fullest for data processing at edge. Make processing at edge automated and configurable to run only required services based on vehicle state (stopped or moving) and battery conditions (for EV).
outcome: Reduced environmental impact through dynamic scaling and edge optimization

title_full: CMOBSUS03-BP01 Align SLAs with sustainability goals
title: Align SLAs with sustainability goals
description: Review and optimize workload SLAs based on sustainability goals to minimize resources required while meeting business needs. Configure workloads to send only minimum required dataset to cloud using low bandwidth network. Send rest of data when connected with Wi-Fi. Process data at edge and only send processed data to cloud. Transform data to human readable format at edge if possible.
outcome: Reduced resource consumption through SLA optimization and edge processing

title_full: CMOBSUS04-BP01 Optimize areas of code that consume the most resources
title: Optimize areas of code that consume the most resources
description: Optimize code running within different components of your architecture to minimize resource usage while maximizing performance. Make software at edge devices as efficient as possible. Run performance tests with managed device farms to identify bottlenecks in advance, as it may not be easy to upgrade hardware resources at the edge.
outcome: Efficient code minimizing resource consumption especially at edge devices

title_full: CMOBSUS05-BP01 Use software patterns and architectures that best support data access and storage patterns
title: Use software patterns and architectures that best support data access and storage patterns
description: Understand how data is used within your workload, consumed by users, transferred, and stored. Connected mobility applications generate different types of data - use software and architecture patterns that align best to data characteristics and access patterns. Use modern data architecture on AWS with purpose-built services optimized for unique use cases.
outcome: Reduced resource usage through purpose-built architectures matching data patterns

title_full: CMOBSUS06-BP01 Optimize impact on devices and equipment
title: Optimize impact on devices and equipment
description: Understand devices and equipment used in your architecture and use strategies to reduce their usage. Minimize wake-up calls - define events that send Wake-up within vehicle bus and send logs (push instead of pull). Perform power studies to enable long-lived connections using least power. Use TCP/IP-based wake up instead of SMS messages through mobile network. Encourage Software Defined Vehicle Architectures with Virtualized Hardware development.
outcome: Extended device lifetime and reduced environmental impact through optimized device usage

title_full: CMOBSUS07-BP01 Use technologies that support data access and storage patterns and implement data classification policy
title: Use technologies that support data access and storage patterns and implement data classification policy
description: Implement appropriate technologies for data access and storage patterns with a data classification policy to minimize environmental impact.
outcome: Optimized data handling through proper classification and technology selection

title_full: CMOBSUS07-BP02 Collect and store only what is needed
title: Collect and store only what is needed
description: Optimize data collection frequency. Collect only what is needed with business and engineering justification, revisiting based on changing needs. Use onboard capability to the fullest. Compress and aggregate data at edge before uploading. Use purpose-built intelligent data collection. Transform and preprocess data at edge wherever possible to minimize transactions with cloud.
outcome: Minimized data collection and transmission reducing environmental impact

title_full: CMOBSUS07-BP03 Avoid multiple connections from the edge
title: Avoid multiple connections from the edge
description: Avoid establishing multiple connections from edge devices to reduce overhead and power consumption.
outcome: Reduced connection overhead and power consumption

title_full: CMOBSUS07-BP04 Maximize data transformation at the edge
title: Maximize data transformation at the edge
description: Make data human readable at the edge to minimize cloud processing requirements.
outcome: Reduced cloud processing through edge data transformation

title_full: CMOBSUS08-BP01 Use policies to manage the lifecycle of your datasets
title: Use policies to manage the lifecycle of your datasets
description: Use microservice-based architecture (run what is needed). Use data lifecycle policy to move data into effective database (cheaper/more sustainable storage). Collect carbon footprint data for vehicle when in motion to help customers with efficient routing and fueling mechanisms.
outcome: Optimized data lifecycle management reducing storage environmental impact

title_full: CMOBSUS08-BP02 Batch ingested data before storing to conserve storage
title: Batch ingested data before storing to conserve storage
description: Batch the ingested data before storing, if possible, to conserve storage resources.
outcome: Reduced storage consumption through data batching

title_full: CMOBSUS08-BP03 Select compute instances and storage mechanisms from a sustainable point of view
title: Select compute instances and storage mechanisms from a sustainable point of view
description: Select compute instances and storage mechanisms considering sustainability. For example, use Graviton instances.
outcome: Reduced environmental impact through sustainable instance selection

title_full: CMOBSUS09-BP01 Use elasticity and automation to expand storage as data grows
title: Use elasticity and automation to expand storage as data grows
description: Use elasticity and automation to expand block storage or file system as data grows to minimize total provisioned storage.
outcome: Minimized over-provisioning through elastic storage

title_full: CMOBSUS09-BP02 Use reduced log level at production
title: Use reduced log level at production
description: Use reduced log level at production to minimize log storage and processing.
outcome: Reduced log storage and processing resource consumption

title_full: CMOBSUS09-BP03 Adopt campaign-based data collection for monitoring
title: Adopt campaign-based data collection for monitoring
description: Adopt campaign-based data collection for monitoring instead of continuous collection to reduce resource consumption.
outcome: Reduced continuous monitoring overhead through campaign-based collection

title_full: CMOBSUS09-BP04 Alert only if needed
title: Alert only if needed
description: Use appropriate notification mechanism (push notifications, SMS, SNS, SES). Adjust notification threshold and interval as needed. Use connected vehicle data to encourage end user to be more sustainable. Create alerts and metrics based on collected data and notify relevant personas. Move old/used/infrequently required data to sustainable storage in specific Regions. Delete data or create rules to delete based on business logic.
outcome: Optimized alerting reducing unnecessary notifications and storage

title_full: CMOBSUS10-BP01 Use the minimum amount of hardware to meet needs and use instance types with least impact
title: Use the minimum amount of hardware to meet needs and use instance types with least impact
description: Right size edge devices to do required processing and maintain performance. Right size cloud resources to reduce environmental impact, save money, and maintain performance benchmarks. Use Graviton-based EC2 instances to reduce cost and power consumption.
outcome: Minimized hardware footprint with optimal instance selection

title_full: CMOBSUS11-BP01 Use managed services to operate more efficiently in the cloud
title: Use managed services to operate more efficiently in the cloud
description: Use managed services in cloud to shift responsibility to AWS for maintaining high utilization and sustainability optimization of deployed hardware. Managed services remove operational and administrative burden, allowing teams to focus on innovation. Use managed service's agent or extension in device to optimize data transfer and network connectivity.
outcome: Improved sustainability through managed service utilization optimization

title_full: CMOBSUS12-BP01 Adopt methods that can rapidly introduce sustainability improvements
title: Adopt methods that can rapidly introduce sustainability improvements
description: Help customers with efficient routing and efficient fueling mechanisms using connected vehicle data.
outcome: Customer-facing sustainability improvements through connected vehicle data

title_full: CMOBSUS13-BP01 Use managed device farms for testing
title: Use managed device farms for testing
description: Establish cloud native testing practices to understand expected impact and test with customers to understand actual impact. Use managed device farms to streamline testing on representative hardware sets including earlier, less popular hardware, avoiding customer sustainability impact from unnecessary device upgrades.
outcome: Sustainable testing practices avoiding unnecessary device production
